file_insights.changes_summary: Refactored grid layouts to use ResponsiveGrid component and improved responsive spacing
key_modifications: Added import of ResponsiveGrid from layout components
Replaced manual grid definitions with ResponsiveGrid component in 3 locations
Converted padding from fixed value (p: 3) to responsive object (p: { xs: 2, sm: 2.5, md: 3 })
Updated gap and margin-bottom to use responsive objects (e.g., gap: { xs: 2, md: 3 })
Updated spacing in loading state skeleton grid layouts

patterns_discovered.description: Replaced repetitive CSS grid definitions with reusable ResponsiveGrid component
patterns_discovered.benefit: Reduces code duplication and improves maintainability

patterns_discovered.description: Multi-breakpoint responsive values using MUI's object notation (xs, sm, md, lg)
patterns_discovered.benefit: Ensures proper mobile, tablet, and desktop layouts

patterns_discovered.description: Standardized spacing values across responsive breakpoints
patterns_discovered.details: xs uses value 2, md/md+ uses value 3, creating visual hierarchy and breathing room

patterns_discovered.description: Applied same responsive grid structure to skeleton loaders as main content
patterns_discovered.benefit: Prevents layout shift and maintains visual consistency during loading

gotchas_discovered.description: One grid layout (main content grid with 2fr 1fr columns) was NOT converted to ResponsiveGrid
gotchas_discovered.impact: Inconsistency in layout approach within same page
gotchas_discovered.suggestion: Consider whether this grid should also use ResponsiveGrid for consistency

gotchas_discovered.description: Different spacing patterns used across components - some use { xs: 2, md: 3 }, others use just 3
affected_areas: ResponsiveGrid components use both direct and responsive spacing
Manual grid layout still uses { xs: 2, md: 3 }
gotchas_discovered.risk: May cause subtle visual inconsistencies at certain breakpoints

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Missing sm Breakpoint in Some Grids
gotchas_discovered.description: ResponsiveGrid columns definition sometimes omits sm breakpoint (e.g., columns={{ xs: 1, md: 4 }})
gotchas_discovered.impact: On sm devices, will use xs breakpoint (1 column) instead of potentially 2 columns

approach_outcome.description: Successfully refactored DashboardPage to use responsive grid component
key_achievements: Replaced 3 major grid layouts with ResponsiveGrid component
Improved mobile responsiveness with proper breakpoint definitions
Applied consistent responsive spacing throughout component
Maintained backward compatibility - all functionality preserved
Reduced inline style complexity by abstracting grid logic

quality_metrics.code_reduction: Eliminated repetitive gridTemplateColumns and gap definitions
quality_metrics.maintainability: Centralized responsive grid logic in single component
quality_metrics.consistency: Improved but not perfect - some layouts still use manual grid

recommendations.recommendation: Migrate the remaining manual grid layout (2fr 1fr grid) to ResponsiveGrid component
recommendations.rationale: Would eliminate the inconsistency in layout approach across the page

recommendations.recommendation: Add sm breakpoint to all ResponsiveGrid columns definitions
recommendations.example: columns={{ xs: 1, sm: 2, md: 4 }} instead of columns={{ xs: 1, md: 4 }}
recommendations.rationale: Tablet devices (sm breakpoint) should show intermediate columns count

recommendations.recommendation: Verify ResponsiveGrid component properly types the 'columns' prop
recommendations.rationale: Ensures compile-time validation of breakpoint values

recommendations.recommendation: Document the breakpoint strategy and spacing conventions in project guidelines
recommendations.rationale: Helps other developers maintain consistency when making future changes

recommendations.recommendation: Add visual regression tests at different viewport sizes
recommendations.rationale: Ensures responsive layouts work correctly across all breakpoints
